Class Point

  • java.lang.Object
    • Point
  • public class Point
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a point object in the first quadrant of a Polar coordinate system.
    Version:
    22-11-2020
    Author:
    Simon Lousky

    • Constructor Detail

      • Point

        public Point​(double x,
             double y)
        Construct a point in Polar coordinate. If one of the parameters is negative then it should be initialized to zero, If x Carthesian coordinate is zero then alpha Polar coordinate should be initialized to 90 degree.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate
        y - The y coordinate

      • Point

        public Point​(Point other)
        Copy constructor for point. Construct a point with the same coordinates as other point.
        Parameters:
        other - The point object from which to construct the new point

    • Method Detail

      • getX

        public double getX()
        Returns the x coordinate of the point.
        Returns:
        The x coordinate of the point.

      • getY

        public double getY()
        Returns the y coordinate of the point.
        Returns:
        The y coordinate of the point.

      • setX

        public void setX​(double num)
        Sets the x coordinate of the point (by suitable Polar coordinates change). If a negative number is received then the x coordinate does not change.
        Parameters:
        num - The new x coordinate

      • setY

        public void setY​(double num)
        Sets the y coordinate of the point (by suitable Polar coordinates change). If a negative number is received then the y coordinate does not change.
        Parameters:
        num - The new y coordinate

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this point.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representasion of this point.

        Check if this point equals other point.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        True if this point equals other point.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • distance

        public double distance​(Point p)
        Calculate the distance between this point and other point.
        Parameters:
        p - The point to calculate the distance from
        Returns:
        The distance between this and p points.

      • move

        public void move​(double dx,
                 double dy)
        Moves the x coordinate by dx and the y coordinate by dy. If movement moves the point outside first quadrant then the point will remain at the same place and not move.
        Parameters:
        dx - The amount to move in the x direction
        dy - The amount to move in the y direction
